class_notes: (THIS COURE IS FULL; contact candlerregistrar@emory.edu to be placed on the waiting list) (Instructor: Ebby Arnold) (ONLINE; Live synchronous meetings Tuesdays 6:00-8:00pm; remaining contact time fulfilled via asynchronous online engagement) (This course will be offered in conjunction with Candler Foundry so will have community participants alongside Candler students)
course_description: This NT 500-level course explores each portion of the New Testament (Pauline letters, gospels and Acts, catholic epistles, and Revelation) by examining how the NT authors describe, explain, or employ the resurrection of Jesus in their respective genres. In addition, portions of the NT reflect different literary genres and so each offers an opportunity for students to practice with a variety of reading methods focusing on rhetoric, narrative, and theology.
sections: Class Nbr: This section is full 5778, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ONLIN, Meets: T 6-8p, Instructor: E. Arnold, Status: Closed
